#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main()
{
    int m, n, r, c, a[102][102], k, tc=1;
    char ch[103];
    while(  scanf("%d %d",&m, &n) )
    {
        if( m == 0 && n == 0 )
            return 0;
        for( r = 0 ; r < m ; r++ )
        {
            for( c = 0 ; c < n ; c++ )
                a[r][c]=0;
        }
        for( r = 0 ; r < m ; r++ )
        {
            scanf("\n%s",&ch);
            for( c = 0 ; c < n ; c++ )
            {
                k=ch[c];
                if( k == '*' )
                {
                    a[r][c]=42;
                    if( r-1 >= 0 && c-1 >= 0 && a[r-1][c-1] != 42 )
                        a[r-1][c-1]+=1;
                    if( r-1 >= 0 && c >= 0 && a[r-1][c] != 42 )
                        a[r-1][c]+=1;
                    if( r-1 < m && c+1 < n && a[r-1][c+1] != 42 )
                        a[r-1][c+1]+=1;
                    if( r >= 0 && c-1 >= 0 && a[r][c-1] != 42 )
                        a[r][c-1]+=1;
                    if( r < m && c+1 < n && a[r][c+1] != 42 )
                        a[r][c+1]+=1;
                    if( r+1 < m  && c-1 >= 0 && a[r+1][c-1] != 42 )
                        a[r+1][c-1]+=1;
                    if( r+1 < m && c < n && a[r+1][c] != 42 )
                        a[r+1][c]+=1;
                    if( r+1 < m && c+1 < n && a[r+1][c+1] != 42 )
                        a[r+1][c+1]+=1;
                }
            }
        }
        printf("Field #%d:\n",tc);
        tc++;
        for( r = 0 ; r < m ; r++ )
        {
            for( c = 0 ; c < n ; c++ )
            {
                if( a[r][c] == '*' )
                    printf("%c",a[r][c]);
                else
                    printf("%d",a[r][c]);
            }
            printf("\n");
        }
        printf("\n");
    }
    return 0;
}
